summary: inTRODUCTION rabies virus (RABV) is a neurotropic virus that almost exclusively invades neurons (1) and causes rabies disease that is fatal in almost 100% of cases. approximately 15,000,000 individuals receive postexposure prophylaxis annually for rabies, which is responsible for over 55,000 human deaths globally each year. rabies remains a serious threat to public health worldwide, especially in developing countries. eukaryotic cytosolic chaperonin TRiC/CCT is a large complex of eight subunits (CCT1 to -8) each that facilitates the folding of proteins through ATP hydrolysis (27). t-complex polypeptide 1 (TCP-1) may be involved in hepatitis B virus capsid assembly. the exact mechanism of CCT function in the RABV life cycle has yet to be determined. the intrinsic in vivo events leading to the recruitment of CCT remain poorly understood. mouse N2a cells were cultured at 37°C with 5% CO2 in DMEM. mouse MAbs to N and P proteins of RABV, as well as rabbit PAb to N protein of RABV, were prepared in our laboratory. in vitro cell infection and sample preparation was carried out according to a previously described method. ylmethylsulfonyl fluoride (PMSF), 20 units/ml DNase I, and 0.25 mg/ml RNase A were vortexed for 1 h and sonicated on ice for 20 min. the supernatant was kept at 80°C until used. equilibrated IPG strips were sealed with 1% low melting-point agarose in SDS buffer. the gels were resolved by 11% SDS-polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis (PAGE) at 80 V for 45 min and then 200 V until the dye front reached the end of the gels. the gel images were normalized according to the total quantity in the analysis set. the dried gel particles were treated with 2 l/well of trypsin (Promega, Madison, WI) in 25 mM ammonium bicarbonate at 4°C for 45 min for rehydration and then incubated at 37°C for 12 h. the extracts were dried under the protection of N2. MS and MS/MS spectra generated were submitted to MASCOT (version 2.1, Matrix Science, London, United Kingdom) the parameters for searches were as follows: national center for biotechnology information nonredundant (NCBInr) database (release date 2009), taxonomy of mouse and viruses. quantitative real-time PCR was performed on the 7500 real-time PCR system (Applied Biosystems) in a total volume of 20 l containing 200 ng of cDNA template, 200 nM each primer, and 1 SYBR premix Ex Taq. the target genes were amplified in triplicate with conditions: an initial denaturation at 95°C for 10 min and 40 cycles of 95°C for 10 s, 60°C for 30 s, and 72°C for ACTB TGTGATGGTGGGTCTCCATGT 140 X03765 Srm ACCAGCTCATGAAGACAGCACTCA TGCTCTCTGT 189 L19311 EIF2S2 TTGCACCACCAGGATAAGGACAT ACAGCAGGGCTAACTGACTGTTCT 101 NM_026030 DLST TGGTGTGTGGGAAGA ATGACACCATCATCATCTCTGTGTTCT 101 NM_026030 the membranes were incubated with mouse MAb to RABV N or rabbit PAb against CCT at 37°C for 2 h. followed by horseradish peroxidase (HRP)-conjugated goat anti-mouse IgG or goat anti-rabbit IgG. FITC-conjugated goat anti-rabbit secondary antibody (KPL) triple-stained cells were washed 5 times with PBS-Tween 20. confocal images were acquired using an inverted leica TCS SP5 microscope. the specific primer sequences for the CCT gene are as follows. for the pCMV-N-Flag construct, forward primer 5′-GGAATTCATGATGGGCCACCGTC-3′ and reverse primer 5′-GCTCTAGATCTCTC-3′ (EcoRI and XbaI restriction sites are underlined) all constructs were verified by DNA sequencing. the coimmunoprecipitation assay was conducted with a minor modification. the lysate supernatant was incubated with the MAb against RABV viral protein N or P, anti-Flag, and antihemagglutinin MAbs overnight at 4°C. lentivirus transduction was carried out according to manufacturer's instructions. a stable N2a cell line expressing CCT shRNA was infected with RABV at an MOI of 0.1. cellular total RNA of the RABV gene was quantified using a relative quantification method. a P value of less than 0.05 was considered significant. mouse neuroblastoma N2a cells and 293T cells were cultured at 37°C. mouse monoclonal antibody (MAb) anti-Flag M2 antibody was purchased from Sigma-Aldrich. mouse MAbs to N and P proteins of RABV, as well as rabbit PAb to N protein of RABV, were prepared in our laboratory. lysis buffer contained 7 M urea, 2 M thiourea, 4% (wt/vol) CHAPS, and 65 mM DTT. mixture was vortexed for 1 h and sonicated on ice for 20 min. centrifugation at 20,000 g for 1 h at 4°C. equilibrated IPG strips were sealed with 1% low melting-point agarose. they were then resolved by 11% SDS-polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. the gels were stained by the modified silver-staining method. gel plugs were thoroughly dried in a speedVac concentrator (thermo Savant, Holbrook, NY, USA) the dried gel particles were treated with 2 l/well of trypsin (Promega, Madison, WI) in 25 mM ammonium bicarbonate at 4°C for 45 min for rehydration. after the trypsin digestion, the peptide mixtures were extracted by 8 l/well of extraction solution (0.5% TFA, 50% ACN peptide spectra were carried out with data Explorer software version 4.5 (Applied Biosystems) in default mode. parent mass peaks with a mass range of 700 to 3,200 Da and minimum signal-to-noise ratio of 20 were selected for TOF/TOF analysis. quantitative real-time PCR was performed using cDNA from N2a cells (12, 48, and 96 h.p.i.) as the template with a RevertAid first strand cDNA synthesis kit. cDNA synthesis was performed with 1 g RNA using oligo(dT) primers (100 ng) CT GCAGGCACTGGTGTCATA TGTCCCATTTTTGGACGGGA 188 AK172867 Prph1 h.p.i., and the protein concentrations were determined by the Bradford assay. blots were developed with superSignal west Femto maximum sensitivity substrate. triple-stained cells were washed 5 times with TRITC-conjugated goat anti-rabbit secondary antibody (KPL) the full-length N and P genes of RABV and the CCT gene were amplified via PCR from the cDNA of RABV-infected N2a cells and then cloned into pCI-neo (Promega, WI, USA), pCMV-N-Flag (Clontech, CA, specific primer sequences for the N gene are as follows. for the pCI-neo construct, forward primer 5′-GAACTCGAGATGGATGCCGACAAGATT-3′ and reverse primer 5′-GCTCTAGATTATGAGTCACTCGAATACGTT-3′ (EcoRI and XbaI restriction sites are underlined) 293T cells transfected with empty vectors pCI-neo, pCMV-N-HA, and pCMV-N-Flag were used as negative controls. the coimmunoprecipitation assay was conducted with a minor modification as stated previously (36). the cells were plated in a 24-well plate with DMEM overnight. lentivirus transduction was carried out according to manufacturer's instructions. lentivirus transduction was carried out according to manufacturer's instructions. RABV-infected cells were treated with or without cycloheximide (CHX; Beyotime, Shanghai, China) at a dose of 100 g/ml. at 8 and 12 h.p.i., cellular total RNA was isolated from resultant cells using TRIzol reagent following manufacturer's protocol. a total of 27 protein spots were found to be dynamically changed in the N2a cells based on the average intensity ratio of proteins detected. a total of 27 protein spots were found to be dynamically changed in the cells based on the average intensity ratio of proteins detected. differentially expressed protein spots are circled. N+ and N- indicate the RABV-infected and mock-infected mouse N2a cells. numbers indicate time (h) postransfection. unnamed gi|26355849 32.24/26.9 5.56/5.9 7/32 2.59 0.35*** 17 67/23 FPGQLNADLR 3432 Tubulin, beta 5 TUBB5 gi|7106439 49.64/39.6 4.78/6.1 12/59 1.32 0.54 3.51 0.51*** 0.63 0.19 20 131/44 FPGQLNADLR 3447 Alpha-tubulin isotype M- ase (E2 component of 2-oxo-glutarate complex) DLST gi|21313536 48.96/52.1 9.11/6.5 14/117 0.91 0.34 2.71 0.57** 3.26 0.64*** 31 176/42 VEGGTPLFTLR NVETMNYADIER 6415 Transaldolase 1, isoform CRA_e TALDO1 gi|148686116 31.51/39.1 7.66/6.8 12/100 12 2.29 0.33** 32 103/33 DLTPEHLPLLR 7328 Heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoprotein D-like HNRPDL gi|81917948 33.54/38.1 6.85/7.3 12/76 1.02 0.23 1.63 0.21* 2.94 0.51*** 30 120/32 GFGFVLFK DLTEYLSR Cell cycle 2155 SET translocation SET gi|123295280 23.1/24.91 5.6 b Accession no. is the MASCOT result of MALDI-TOF/TOF searched from the NCBInr database. e Protein spots with an abundance ratio for infected/uninfected cells of less than 0.5 were downregulated. spots with a ratio greater than 2 were upregulated. h Peptides identified by MALDI-TOF/TOF with a statistically significant ion score of great than 64 (P 0.05) were considered successfully identified. 27 protein spots with a threshold greater than 2-fold were selected for in-gel trypsin digestion. some of the cellular proteins, such as hypothetical protein LOC433182, Hsp90, CCT, and OAS1B, were newly induced in RABV-infected N2a cells. the genes encoding the 13 differentially expressed proteins were selected for validation by real-time PCR (Fig. 3B and Table 2). RABV replication induced the persistent upregulation of cellular chaperonins CCT and Hsp90 in mouse N2a cells. cytosolic Hsp90 showed some colocalization with intracellular CCT. cytosolic Hsp90 showed some colocalization with the hollow ringlike inclusions containing the viral protein N and P. in mock-infected N2a cells, CCT and Hsp90 were homogeneously distributed in the cytoplasm of N2a cells. confocal microscopy also showed that CCT colocalized with the viral protein N was a hollow circle-like structure in mouse N2a cells cotransfected with the viral N and P genes. notably, there was no colocalization of CCT and Hsp90 with viral proteins in N2a cells that only expressed either either colocalization of viral proteins P (green) and N (red) formed a hollow cricoid-like structure (Merge) in mouse N2a cells cotransfected with RABV N and P genes. the coimmunoprecipitation assay was performed in the N2a cells infected with RABV and cotransfected with CCT. the viability of shCCT-transfected N2a cells was detected by CCK-8 assay. the results showed that the viability of shCCT-transfected N2a cells was decreased slightly in comparison with that of N2a and nontargeting-shc002v-transfected N2a cells (P > 0.05) RABV replication was monitored by quantitative real-time PCR. the virus titer in the cell supernatants and cellular viral genomic RNA had no significant changes (P > 0.05) in CCT-overexpressing N2a cells. mRNA transcripts of RABV N gene were determined by real-time comparative quantitative PCR. RABV replication reached a maximum at about 48 h.p.i. with a titer of 106.55 TCID50. the viral N protein of RABV was only detected at 48 and 96 h.p.i. from RABV-infected N2a cells. these data showed that infectious RABV progeny were generated in the N2a cell monolayers. most of the differentially expressed proteins were found at 48 and 96 h.p.i. Fig 2. Dynamic 2-DE profiles of the differentially expressed proteins in RABV-infected mouse N2a cells. differentially expressed protein spots are circled. N+ and N- indicate the RABV-infected and mock-infected mouse N2a cells. numbers indicate time (h) postransfection. D-like HNRPDL gi|81917948 33.54/38.1 6.85/7.3 12/76 1.02 0.23 1.63 0.21* 2.94 0.51*** 30 120/32 GFGF b Accession no. is the MASCOT result of MALDI-TOF/TOF searched from the NCBInr database. e Protein spots with an abundance ratio for infected/uninfected cells of less than 0.5 were downregulated. spots with a ratio greater than 2 were upregulated. g Protein score (based on combined MS and MS/MS spectra) and best ion score (based on MS/MS spectra) were from MALDI-TOF/TOF identification. 27 protein spots with a threshold greater than 2-fold were selected for in-gel trypsin digestion. several protein spots (e.g., nucleoprotein and peripherin) were identified as the product of the same gene. some of the cellular proteins, such as hypothetical protein LOC433182, Hsp90, CCT, and OAS1B, were newly induced in RABV-infected N2a cells. the results provide information complementary to the differential proteomics data obtained with 2-DE and MS/MS. translational and transcriptional profiling of altered proteins in RABV-infected mouse N2a cells. cytosolic Hsp90 showed some colocalization with the hollow ring-like inclusions containing N and P. however, in mock-infected N2a cells, CCT and Hsp90 were homogeneously distributed in the cytoplasm of N2a cells. confocal microscopy also showed that CCT colocalized with the viral protein N was a hollow circle-like structure in mouse N2a cells cotransfected with the viral N and P genes the triple-stained cells were observed by confocal microscopy. coimmunoprecipitation analysis could not confirm interaction between CCT and viral protein N or P in either RABV-infected N2a cells or cotransfected N2a cells. Western blot analysis confirmed that CCT expression was significantly decreased in the N2a cells transfected with CCT shRNA. the viability of shCCT-transfected N2a cells was detected by CCK-8 assay. RABV replication was monitored by quantitative real-time PCR. the virus titer in the cell supernatants and cellular viral genomic RNA had no significant changes (P > 0.05) in CCT-overexpressing N2a cells. RABV replication was not upregulated in CCT-overexpressing cells. genomic RNA of RABV in shRNA-silenced cells decreased 80% (P 0.01) in comparison with that in cells transfected with nontargeting shRNA shcoo2v. mRNA transcripts of RABV N gene were determined by real-time comparative quantitative PCR. cells transfected only with the RABV viral N or P gene, CCT was not colocalized with either expressed viral protein. this indicates that the colocalization and interaction of viral proteins N and P is crucial to NBs. these data confirm that only the RABV N/P complex and not the individual viral proteins could recruit CCT molecules to NBs. in vivo and in vitro experiments, Hsp70 was found to associate with chaperonin CCT, suggesting their cooperation in the process of protein folding (43, 46, 47). a reasonable hypothesis is that the functions of CCT in the RABV life cycle may need other cellular factors' cooperation. a recent study demonstrated the interaction of Hsp70 with viral protein N of RABV (11) in N2a cells infected with RABV and cotransfected with N and P expression vectors. cytoskeletal protein profiles were altered by RABV infection in N2a cells. RABV infection resulted in the upregulation of a series of energy metabolism-related proteins, including IDH3A, DLST, LOC433182, and TALDO1. DLST (E2) is the structural and catalytic core of the 2-oxo acid dehydrogenase multienzyme complex. our data indicate that the host protein CCT is associated with but not a core factor of NBs in RABV-infected N2a cells. further studies are needed to determine the exact mechanism of CCT function in the RABV life cycle.
